newsitem.title: UK: UK beet sowings virtually complete - British Sugar.
newsitem.headline: UK beet sowings virtually complete - British Sugar.

text.p: British farmers have virtually completed sowings of the 1997/98 sugar beet crop and are still ahead of the equivalent stage a year ago, a British Sugar official said on Monday.
Ground drillings were now 98 percent complete, compared with 93 percent last year, he said.
Farmers took advantage of mild spring weather to drill their beets early, ensuring that overall sowings outpaced last year.
"We are having a good spring this year -- they saw the drilling window and went for it," the official said. British Sugar's recommended drilling period is from March 10 to April 10.
"It is virtually all in but now they need some rain. It's not too dry...there's been very little redrilling but the ground needs some gentle rain to get it going," he added.
Britain is expected to have a total beet area of 170,000 hectares, the same as in 1996/97.
Britain produced a record 1.48 million tonnes of sugar in white value terms from its 1996/97 beet crop. The previous record was in 1992/93, when around 1,000 tonnes less sugar was produced.
